reviews.text: From the moment you walk in, it's a wonderful experience.The woman running the gift shop was very helpful and very sweet. The tour guide was knowledgeable, entertaining, and engaging. Jennie and her family's story came alive through this experience and I would highly recommend anyone visiting in Gettysburg make this one of their stops!

I've been to Gettysburg several times, but this was the first time I took the tour for the Jenny Wade house. My family enjoyed it. This presents a nice view of what ordinary citizens were experiencing during the historic battle, and this house was caught in the crossfire.  The story is tragic but true, and there are several unexpected twists in it that are revealed at the end of the tour. The guide was knowledgeable and kind and worth a tip at the end.

The only civilian killed during the Battle for Gettysburg. Jennie was simply baking bread when a stray bullet killed her. A grave couldn't be dug at that time because of the 3-day battle, so her body was kept in the basement. You'll hear the story & see where everything happened. I'd recommend a stop here if you're studying the Civil War.

The Jenny wade house tour was interesting. A must go while visiting Gettysburg. You can see the bullet hole that went through and caused Jenny’s death. It is a pretty cool place to see and our tour guide was great at story telling. 

Jenny wade was the only civilian killed during the civil war and her final resting place is in the basement of the house. This is the original home not a lot of space to move around look out for ghost children to moving the chain when you walk by.

Really liked the tour. Neat to see what it was like during the battle of gettysburg. Informative. House replicated to the era. Neat little historic tidbits as well. Would recommend to go at least once!

Great visitor center with great presentations. Highly recommend the Winter Lecture series. Many fantastic historians all over the park. I've studied Gettysburg for over 25 years and this weekend I walked away learning even more. To truly appreciate American history one needs the Gettysburg experience

Very neat the visitor center is nice.
Thank goodness for the maps & the studio CD (you can get at the visitor center store.) - if you do the tour on your own. 
The monuments are really cool.  The historic landmarks are so surreal.  
The houses along the route are just beautiful.
If you have time & money... you may want to do the bus tour. We're headed one behind us... it looked fun!!
**make sure you start you tour very early in the day. (So you have enough time & daylight)  
Make sure you have your camera & batteries enough media storage for pictures. 
Enjoy the walk/ drive through history.
Enjoy the pictures.

Excellent national park. I don't think a gift shop at a war memorial is appropriate, and I also believe that if you're going to charge admission for a museum dedicated to thousands of soldiers who died in the name of freedom, you should at least provide a discount for veterans and active military (I'm referring to visitor center). That being said, the battlefield itself is beautifully preserved and the monuments are impressive. It's a solemn reminder of the cost of freedom

This place will bring out emotion you wouldn't even expect. So sad seeing the battlefields and understanding how everything went down, but then you see where the Gettysburg Address was give and you cant help but feel proud. It was a roller coaster of emotions but amazing at the same time. Absolutely worth the trip.

I love Gettysburg, the history of the battle is just amazing and fascinating with so much to learn.  The free battle walks are the best and you get to learn so much.  My favorite ranger is Matt Atkinson.  He puts on quite the show and has lots and lots of knowledge on all aspects of the battle.  This place is a great place to visit to learn about one of the most interesting battles of the war.

This was really the Gettysburg bike event parade that we were watching in front of the center.  Bike week goes on for 3 days and on Saturday they have the parade of chrome (motorcycles). It is great to watch the different motorcycles
Only spent a short time there. Started snowing so we left early. Very educational

We attended Gettysburgs 1st annual Christmas celebration. The Heritage Center was absolutely gorgeous. Unfortunately the weather was not the best for this event. Anxious to visit again next Christmas!!

What an amazing museum! Admission is 8.95 per adult, and very well worth it. Interactive exhibits and panels discuss the history of the town, and a little about the battle. The main focus is on civilian life and thought,  and the war's aftermath. There is one longer intro video about the battle (VERY well done), and 4 shorter 3D videos. The cellar exhibit was one of the better interactive things I've seen. Definitely make this a first stop. The gentleman working at the counter is genuinely a great guy- warm and welcoming. We'll definitely be back on our next trip here.
We went for the christmas festival. Got to watch them sculpt Ice. Pretty neat.
Cool little place with nice charm to it.  Staff was friendly and the food was good.  Sitting inside felt like a step back in time.  Metered parking outside.

I love Ernie's!  Breakfast is my favorite meal here, pictured is my last order.  Chipped Beef Gravy on pancakes (!) with a side of hash browns topped with their hot dog chili.

For lunch, get "one with," a hot dog with chill, mustard, and diced onion.  I've tweaked my order a bit so I get mine "well done, light onions, extra mustard."  A small chili cheese fries is the perfect complement!
This is a Gettysburg icon! Fairest breakfast prices in town! The old time comfy feel is just the perfect place to escape for a bit
Best hot dog ever. French fries over the top! Service exceptional.
So nice and food was so good

Great place to eat and visit. Tons of options on the Buffett and the food changes daily. Lunch and dinner prices very reasonable at lunch. Awesome desserts and service always a great place to visit. Great gift shop upstairs reasonable prices and a huge selection for a little shop. A must in G-town for variety and southern taste.

I surrendered.  I understand why they call it pickets charge.  Pickets army charges the food food bar. The barrages of great tasty food never stops.  Instead of leaving the battle field defeated... you leave full and happy and with money to spend.

great place! good food, the cooker is Mexican and aligns the American recipes with her cooking style, so the result is amazing. extremely recommended. 
also the price is fair. this place is a must. they serve many dishes

Been eating here for years! Home cooking all you can eat buffet. Worth money!! Great family dining experience. Clean. Employees are friendly as well. Buffet kept well stocked. Drinks filled and tables are cleared. Longest i have waited for a table was 45 minutes at the height of tourist season with buses. We go here every year while visiting Gettysburg every summer.
Great food. Great service! Our family enjoyed everything they had to offer on their buffets. Great place to eat before or after the visit to the Gettysburg battlefield.

Great food! Stopped here for the first time and was pleasantly surprised. When we got there, there was a very long line waiting. The hostess said only 15 - 20 minutes, and she was spot on. The food was pricey, but very delicious and generous portions. We are excited to go back.

Absolutely fantastic food, wonderful friendly staff! A phenomenal waitress named Emily works very hard there and deserves to be tipped well!!! She is very kind, hardworking, and attentive to the diners. Great place for dining or take out!

We’ve been going to Bella Italia for years. The large Pesto Pizza and excellent service keep us coming back. Eating here you feel like you’re dining in Rome. The walls are painted in a Mediterranean style and the decorations displayed throughout the restaurant give the same vibe. I look forward to my next visit!
Favorite place to eat. So many choices. Very friendly. Nice and clean. Relaxing.
Great food. Sometimes can have long wait times when eating in house. But overall great.

I'd been here before and had to make the 2 hour motorcycle ride back on a nice sunny day. Everything from the greeting, the seating, the feedings and the farewell felt like a family affair. Their homemade recipes are amazing and the pricing is fair. An improvement would be for the servers to let the customers know that even though a meal has fries as a side, there's an additional charge for them. I didn't notice until I received the ticket, and was surprised although it didn't detract enough from everything else to rate the entire experience lower.

I can't wait to return and try another dish!

Very delicious restaurant with a lot of options to satisfy everyone at your table. The cheese fries are delicious as are the NY Strip and Chicken Quesadilla. Peach sangria is also delicious. The staff Were very courteous and attentive. No complaints here at all. As a side note, if you are looking for a quiet place for dinner, this is not it. They have live entertainment at least on Saturday nights which was also amazing, but it is very noisy if you are trying to talk. Keep up the awesome work!
Great location in center of town. I stayed at the local inn and this was a brief 3 minute walk.  Numerous food choices; moderate prices.  Full bar.  I would recommend this establishment.
Simply amazing food, great atmosphere. If you have never tried Irish nachos I strongly advise giving them a shot. The awesome staff make a great experience even better.
Very good service. Food was fresh and good. Sat outside. Nice atmosphere

Absolutely fantastic.  First, was the best clam chowder I've had in my life followed by some of the most delicious wings I've had.  If you're thinking about going here, do it!  Seriously great food, atmosphere and staff. Not to mention the cost is extremely affordable .

Great family restaurant in Gettysburg. If you want a good home cooked hot meal, this is the place to go. Loved the decor as well. Our server Ashlea was very attentive, accommodating, and kind. I had the buffalo chicken wrap with fries and would definitely get it again. They have lots of options including seafood, steak, wraps, sandwiches, salads, and homemade soup. We had a great experience and would come again.

Little hidden gem just north of the center of town in Gettysburg Pa. Very diverse menu with good prices. Fast friendly service, serving breakfast lunch and dinner. The cream of crab soup was incredible! Definitely worth the stop!

Another great place in town for breakfast.  We try to go at least once every two weeks.  Staff is outstanding and the food is always good.  We usually get the sausage links instead of patties.  We think they have a better flavor.  Anyway you won't be disappointed.  We live in Gettysburg and this is where we like to go for breakfast

Stopped in with my husband after some kind of a Christmas festival, and man, I wish that I lived closer! Wonderful food for a price that won’t break the bank, and lots of different, unexpected choices. Everything was delicious, and the waitresses were lovely. If you’re looking for an inexpensive, casual family dinner, with hearty, Pennsylvania style cooking, you’re absolutely in luck.
Friendly employees, we had fun stopping here for a treat.
Love the custard. The high shool kids working there a re very polite and give you fast service.

This is a great Ritas.   Good service and a nice location.  However, I think its getting a little pricey.  I mean, $3.50 for a 4 oz cup!  It's not that great.  My wife and I have been going here for years, but we will probably cut back.

I love this Ritas.   The location is a little hard to park at but there ice makes up for it.  I park across the street and walk over usually. The prices are reasonable and the service is good.  It makes a good snack after a hot day of tromping the battlefield!
Family loves the Gettysburg location and scenery...Their vanilla custard is awesome and they offer a free small dish of custard to dog with any orders, along with ice taste testing...
